question: Integrate the function: $\sin x \cdot \sin (\cos x)$
solution:
Step 1:

Let $\cos x = t$

Differentiating both sides w.r.t. $x$

$-\sin x = \frac{dt}{dx}$

$dx = \frac{dt}{-\sin x}$

Step 2:

Integrating function

$\int \sin x . \sin (\cos x) . dx$

Putting values of $t$ & $dt$

$= \int \sin x . \sin t . \frac{dt}{-\sin x}$

$= -\int \sin t . dt$

$= -(-\cos t + C)$

$= \cos t + K$

Putting $t = \cos x$

$= \cos(\cos x) + K$
